styleDescription: A zone control fighting style based on historical spear techniques, featuring reach advantage, range manipulation, and area control tactics.
historicalInspiration: This style draws primarily from Japanese sōjutsu (yari/spear techniques) of feudal Japan, with influences from European pike formations and Chinese qiangfa (spear methods). The stances are based on kamae positions from the Tenshin Shōden Katori Shintō-ryū and other traditional Japanese martial schools that included spear combat.

cards.name: Hoko-no-kamae
cards.subtitle: Spear Guard
cards.effect: Enter the Hoko-no-kamae stance. While in this stance, your attacks deal +1 damage at Far Range.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, also gain 1 Reach Advantage when you deal damage at Far Range.
cards.flavorText: The warrior extends the spear with perfect balance, creating a deadly zone that opponents must navigate with extreme caution.

cards.name: Gedan-gamae
cards.subtitle: Low Guard
cards.effect: Enter the Gedan-gamae stance. While in this stance, reduce damage from Close Range attacks by 1. Gain 1 Reach Advantage when changing to Far Range.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, after reducing damage, you may change range.
cards.flavorText: The spear is held low and angled, creating a defensive barrier while preparing to extend distance with a swift backward step.

cards.name: Chudan-gamae
cards.subtitle: Middle Guard
cards.effect: Enter the Chudan-gamae stance. While in this stance, you may spend 2 Reach Advantage to change range and draw a card.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, also reduce the next attack's damage by 1 after changing range.
cards.flavorText: The spear is held at center height with perfect balance, allowing swift transitions between advance and retreat with minimal telegraph.

cards.name: Tsuki
cards.subtitle: Thrusting Strike
cards.effect: Deal 2 damage. If at Far Range, deal +1 damage and gain 1 Reach Advantage.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, you may spend 2 Reach Advantage to make this attack unreducible by defensive effects.
cards.flavorText: A lightning-fast thrust with perfect extension, the spear tip finding its mark before the opponent can react to the subtle movement.

cards.name: Harai
cards.subtitle: Sweeping Technique
cards.effect: Deal 1 damage. Change to your preferred range and gain 2 Reach Advantage.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, also force your opponent to exit their current stance.
cards.flavorText: The spear sweeps in a wide arc, simultaneously creating distance while disrupting the opponent's position and balance.

cards.name: Kaeshi
cards.subtitle: Redirecting Thrust
cards.effect: Deal 2 damage. You may spend 2 Reach Advantage to change range after this attack resolves.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, if you change to Far Range, this attack deals +2 damage.
cards.flavorText: A deceptive thrust that begins as one attack before smoothly transitioning into another, allowing perfect distance control throughout the sequence.

cards.name: Sune-kake
cards.subtitle: Shaft Block
cards.effect: Play when your opponent plays an attack. Reduce that attack's damage by 1 and gain 1 Reach Advantage. If at Far Range, also change to Close Range.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, also deal 1 damage to your opponent.
cards.flavorText: The spear shaft intercepts the incoming attack, allowing the warrior to slide forward along the weapon to close distance with perfect timing.

cards.name: Ashi-sabaki
cards.subtitle: Footwork Mastery
cards.effect: Gain 2 Reach Advantage. Change range if desired. Your next Spear card costs 1 less to play this turn.
cards.masterEffect: If you've played 2+ Spear cards this turn, also draw a card if you're at your preferred range.
cards.flavorText: The spear wielder shifts position with masterful footwork, controlling the engagement distance with subtle movements that create perfect striking opportunities.

cards.name: Ancestral Thrust
cards.subtitle: Legacy Attack
cards.effect: Deal 2 damage. If at Far Range, deal +2 damage. You may spend any amount of Reach Advantage to add that much additional damage. This attack cannot be reduced by defensive effects.
cards.drawback: After this attack resolves, change to Close Range and take 1 damage.
cards.flavorText: The perfect thrust handed down through generations, combining power and precision that few can match, though the extension leaves your aging body momentarily vulnerable.

cards.name: Elder's Zone Control
cards.subtitle: Legacy Technique
cards.effect: Gain 4 Reach Advantage immediately. Change to Far Range. All your opponents' attacks cost +1 energy until your next turn.
cards.drawback: You cannot change stance until the end of your next turn.
cards.flavorText: Decades of practice allow perfect zone control that transcends conscious thought, though maintaining such mastery taxes your weathered body's flexibility.

cards.name: Generational Defense
cards.subtitle: Legacy Stance
cards.effect: Enter the Generational Defense stance. While in this stance, when attacked, gain 2 Reach Advantage and change to your preferred range. Reduce damage by 1 at Far Range.
cards.drawback: Each time you change range while in this stance, discard a card.
cards.flavorText: The defensive technique refined through your bloodline creates an impenetrable zone of control, though each movement now requires greater sacrifice as you age.
